questions.question_text: Laukiko vyavahāras-tu __________-nirvāha-hetukah । Naiva sa paramam lakṣhyam asya manuṣhya-janmanaha ॥
questions.explanation: The shlok states: Laukiko vyavahāras-tu deha-nirvāha-hetukah. This means worldly interactions are for the purpose of maintaining the body.

questions.question_text: Karoḍ kām bagāḍīne paṇ ek mokṣha sudhārvo ne kadāpi karoḍ kām sudhāryā ne ek mokṣha bagāḍyo to temā shu karyu?
questions.explanation: This quotation is from Swamini Vato 1/14, emphasizing the importance of moksha over worldly tasks.

questions.question_text: Nāshāya sarva-doṣhāṇām __________-sthiter avāptaye । Kartum Bhagavato bhaktim asya dehasya lambhanam ॥
questions.explanation: The shlok states: Nāshāya sarva-doṣhāṇām brahma-sthiter avāptaye. This indicates the body is obtained to destroy all faults and attain brahma-sthiti.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇe paṇ e Akṣharrūp je mukta temanī panktimā bhaḷavu chhe ane Akṣhardhāmmā jaīne akhanḍ Bhagwānnī sevāmā hajūr rahevu chhe, paṇ nāshavant ne tuchchh evu je māyik sukh tene ichchhavu nathī ne emā koī ṭhekāṇe lobhāvu nathī.
questions.explanation: This quotation is from Vachanamrut Gadhada Pratham 21, describing the desire to join Akshardham and serve Bhagwan.

questions.question_text: "…marī to sarvene javu chhe paṇ āvī rīte bhakti karavī e ja __________ moṭo lābh chhe…"
questions.explanation: The Vachanamrut states: “...marī to sarvene javu chhe paṇ āvī rīte bhakti karavī e ja jīvyāno moṭo lābh chhe...” emphasizing that performing bhakti is the greatest benefit of life.

questions.question_text: Ā meḍiyu maḷī chhe ne sāru sāru khāvā maḷe chhe, ke mān maḷe chhe, ityādik manuṣhya dehnu faḷ nathī. Te to vimukhne paṇ maḷe chhe. Māṭe manuṣhya dehnu faḷ to sārāno sang ne swabhāv ṭaḷe, eṭalu ja chhe.
questions.explanation: This quotation is from Swamini Vato 2/19, explaining that the purpose of the human body is to associate with the good and eliminate bad habits, not just to enjoy worldly pleasures.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek __________ thāvu, emā deh antarāyrūp chhe; ne bīju Bhagwānmā joḍāvu, temā sang anek prakārnā antarāyrūp chhe.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato states: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek Akṣharrūp thāvu... It describes the two goals of human birth.

questions.question_text: Nāshvant ā deh vadhethi, avinashi fal levu ji, patrāvaane jemi karine, bahaar feki devu ji
questions.explanation: This kirtan is by Narayandas Swami and emphasizes attaining everlasting fruit from this perishable body.

questions.question_text: Laukik vyavahār to __________ nirvāh māṭe chhe. Te ā manuṣhya janmanu param lakṣhya nathī.
questions.explanation: The shlok translates to: Worldly interactions are for the purpose of maintaining the body, not the ultimate goal of human birth.

questions.question_text: Sarva doṣhone ṭāḷavā, __________ pāmavā ane Bhagwānnī bhakti karavā ā deh maḷyo chhe.
questions.explanation: The shlok states that this body is obtained to eliminate all faults, attain brahma-sthiti, and perform devotion to Bhagwan.
